title.narrative: Joint Program for Livelihoods Recovery in Cyclone Giri Affected Communities

description.narrative: In response to Cyclone Giri, Mercy Corps and partners, Community Development Association (CDA) and Rakhine Thahaya Association (RTA), conducted an initial assessment in November 2010. This was later followed up by a further assessment in January 2011. In response to the current and impending livelihoods emergency in the region, Mercy Corps is implementing the ‘Joint Programme for Livelihoods Recovery in Cyclone Giri Affected Communities’ with the overall goal of enhanced and sustainable agricultural livelihoods recovery in Cyclone GIRI-affected Myanmar. This goal is being achieved as farmers are able to resume production of paddy as a result of project support for embankment rehabilitation and provision of agricultural inputs, and when fishers are able to resume fishing as a result of replacement of damaged or destroyed boats and nets. This is the most relevant intervention in the targeted area because of the heavy reliance on paddy farming and fishing in Rakhine State, and because of the urgent need to restore productive capacity quickly. Targeting these activities, especially embankment rehabilitation using cash for work, is of key strategic importance for economic recovery to take place, providing food and revenue to employ casual laborers.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
